snippet: Representative Trey Gowdy, who will lead the new House panel investigating the 2012 attack in Libya, has more nuanced relationships with Democrats than many conservative brethren.
abstract: Republican Rep Trey Gowdy of South Carolina, who will lead House panel investigating the 2012 attack on diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, has more nuanced relationships with Democrats than many conservative brethren; former prosecutor has made name for himself in barely two terms in office for his tenacious questioning of Obama administration officials.
lead_paragraph: Representative Trey Gowdy, who will lead the new House panel investigating the 2012 attack in Libya, has more nuanced relationships with Democrats than many conservative brethren.

headline.main: Reputation for Zeal Precedes Republican Leading New Benghazi Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Reputation for Zeal Precedes Republican Leading New Benghazi Inquiry
